title: Cristiano Ronaldo 900 goals: Remembering best CR7 strikes for club and country as he sets new goal-scoring record | Sporting News India
text: Cristiano Ronaldo has set yet another astonishing record by scoring his 900th career goal, a milestone that solidifies his status as one of the greatest footballers the world has ever seen. It's nearly impossible to imagine any other male player ever reaching this incredible feat. From his early days at Sporting CP to his stints with Manchester United, Real Madrid, Juventus, and currently Al Nassr, Ronaldo's career has been nothing short of legendary. His accolades include five Ballon d'Or awards, numerous titles across three of Europe's top five leagues, and five UEFA Champions League trophies. Part of Portugal's winning Euro 2016 side, [Ronaldo also boasts the record for most international goals scored by a male player](https://www.sportingnews.com/in/football/news/most-goals-scored-international-football-messi-ronaldo-record/osiuroawzw1asvbi2t37z2be) and is the only man to have played more than 200 games for his senior national team. On September 5, 2024, Ronaldo struck his historic 900th goal, meeting a pinpoint cross from the left from Nuno Mendes before turning the ball home from close range, doubling Portugal's lead against Croatia in the UEFA Nations League. He was clearly emotional as he celebrated the famous moment.
